fig.title: a) Rapamycin (Rap) treatment or nutrient deprivation attenuated the expression of the Wnt reporter TopFlash in HEK-293T cells.
fig.label: figf1
fig.sd-panel: a) Rapamycin (Rap) treatment or nutrient deprivation attenuated the expression of the Wnt reporter TopFlash in HEK-293T cells. (n = 3; two asterisks, P 0.01). DMSO, dimethylsulphoxide.
(b) Expression analysis of Wnt target genes by quantitative RT-PCR after 4 h of treatment with rapamycin. (n = 3; asterisk, P 0.05; two asterisks, P 0.01). Wnt3a CM, Wnt3a conditioned medium.
(c) Knockdown of LC3 or Beclin 1 potentiated Wnt signalling. (n = 3; asterisk, P 0.05).

(d) Atg5 knockout enhanced Wnt signalling. TopFlash reporter activity induced by Wnt3a CM in Atg5−/− or wild-type MEFs. Results are means ± s.d. after normalization to Renilla luciferase activity. (n = 3; asterisk, P 0.05).

fig.title: a) Dvl2 underwent autophagy-mediated degradation.
fig.label: figf2
fig.sd-panel: (a) Dvl2 underwent autophagy-mediated degradation. E-cadherin was used as a loading control for membrane fraction, and tubulin as a loading control for cytosolic proteins. The asterisk indicates the phosphorylated form of Dvl2.

(b) The half-life of Dvl2 was prolonged in Atg5−/− cells. MEFs were subjected to starvation (starv.) for the indicated durations and harvested for immunoblotting with the indicated antibodies. Dvl2 levels were quantified (right panel). Autophagy induction is indicated by the levels of LC3 II and p62 degradation.

(c) Reintroduction of Atg5 in Atg5−/− MEFs restored starvation-induced Dvl2 degradation. MEFs infected with recombinant adenovirus expressing GFP or Atg5 were starved for the indicated durations, and the cell lysates were subjected to immunoblotting with the indicated antibodies.

(d) Dvl2 degradation was slowed down in Atg7−/− MEFs. MEFs were subjected to starvation for the indicated durations and harvested for immunoblotting with the indicated antibodies. Dvl2 levels were quantified (right panel).

sd-panel.p: (e) The continued degradation of Dvl2 in Atg5−/− cells is proteasome-dependent. MEFs were starved for 2, 4 or 8 h with MG132 (1 μM) or BFA1 (0.1 μM) for different durations, followed by anti-Dvl2 immunoblotting to detect endogenous Dvl2 protein levels. Tubulin served as a loading control. Uncropped images of blots are shown in Supplementary Information, Fig. S8.

fig.title: a) Immunoelectron microscopy analysis of HeLa cells transfected with Flag–Dvl2 under nutrient-rich or starvation conditions.
fig.label: figf3

sd-panel.p: (a) Immunoelectron microscopy analysis of HeLa cells transfected with Flag-Dvl2 under nutrient-rich or starvation conditions. The arrowheads indicate Flag-Dvl2. Scale bars, 1 μm (left); 250 nm (right).

(b) Localization of endogenous Dvl proteins (red) and GFP-LC3 (green) in GFP-LC3 stable HeLa cells in nutrient-rich medium or under starvation (starv.) conditions with BFA1 for 4 h. The right panel shows the percentage co-localization between Dvls and GFP-LC3-positive dots. Scale bar, 5 μm.

p.span: ) Immunoelectron microscopy analysis of HeLa cells transfected with Flag-Dvl2 and GFP-LC3 under starvation conditions. Arrows indicate Flag-Dvl2; arrowheads indicate GFP-LC3. Scale bar, 250 nm.

fig.sd-panel: (d) Dvl2-LC3 interaction in vivo. IB, immunoblotting; IP, immunoprecipitation; S, starvation; WCL, whole-cell lysate; N, nutrient-rich.

(e, f) Dvl2 interacts directly with LC3 (e) and GABARAP (f) but not with GATE-16 in vitro. GST pulldown assay using in vitro-translated Flag-Dvl2 and immobilized GST or the indicated GST fusions. Precipitated proteins were detected with anti-Flag antibody. Coomassie staining of GST and GST-LC3 protein is shown.

(e, f) Dvl2 interacts directly with LC3 (e) and GABARAP (f) but not with GATE-16 in vitro. GST pulldown assay using in vitro-translated Flag-Dvl2 and immobilized GST or the indicated GST fusions. Precipitated proteins were detected with anti-Flag antibody. Coomassie staining of GST and GST-LC3 protein is shown.

(g) The LC-3-binding motif is important for the Dvl2-LC3 interaction. GST-LC3-immobilized beads were incubated with the lysates from the cells expressing wild-type (WT) Dvl2 or the W444A, I447A mutant (MUT); the pulldowns were then subjected to anti-haemagglutinin (anti-HA) immunoblotting. Uncropped images of blots are shown in Supplementary Information, Fig. S8.

fig.title: a) Interaction between LC3 and wild-type Dvl2 or its point mutants.
fig.label: figf4
fig.sd-panel: (a) Interaction between LC3 and wild-type Dvl2 or its point mutants.

sd-panel.p: (b) Ubiquitylation of wild-type Dvl2 and its variants. Transfected HEK-293T cells were treated with BFA1 (0.2 μM) for 6 h. Ubiquitylated proteins were precipitated with Ni-nitrilotriacetate (Ni-NTA) beads, followed by anti-HA immunoblotting. Ub, ubiquitin.
(c) Degradation kinetics of wild-type Dvl2 and its variants under starvation conditions. Lower panel: quantification of the immunoblotting results.
(d) Starvation promotes co-localization of Dvl, ubiquitin and p62. Scale bar, 10 μm.
(e) Starvation induces the formation of high-molecular-mass Dvl2 aggregates.
(f) p62 knockdown alters Dvl localization. Scale bar, 10 μm. Uncropped images of blots are shown in Supplementary Information, Fig. S8.

fig.title: a) Knockdown of p62 expression attenuates the LC3–Dvl2 interaction.
fig.label: figf5

sd-panel.p: (a) Knockdown of p62 expression attenuates the LC3-Dvl2 interaction. shRNA, short hairpin RNA.

(b) Co-localization of GFP-LC3, p62 and Dvl in HeLa GFP-LC3 stable cells on starvation. Proteins visualized by immunofluorescence with anti-GFP (green), anti-p62 (blue) and anti-Dvl (red) antibodies. Scale bar, 10 μm.

(c) p62 knockdown slows the degradation of Dvl2 on starvation. HEK-293T cells were transfected with p62 siRNA. At 48 h after transfection, cells were subjected to starvation for various times. The cell lysates were subjected to immunoblotting with the antibodies indicated. Uncropped images of blots are shown in Supplementary Information, Fig. S8.

fig.title: a) Ubiquitylation of Dvl2 enhanced by ectopically expressed pVHL.
fig.label: figf6

sd-panel.p: (a) Ubiquitylation of Dvl2 enhanced by ectopically expressed pVHL.

(b) In vitro ubiquitylation of Dvl2 by the pVHL E3 ligase complex including pVHL, Elongin B, Elongin C, Rbx1 and Cul2. In vitro-translated Flag-Dvl2 was incubated with or without purified E1, E2 and E3 ligase complex, Elongin C and pVHL. The reaction was subjected to anti-Flag immunoprecipitation. Dvl2 ubiquitylation was examined by using anti-ubiquitin immunoblotting.
(c) Ubiquitylation of Dvl2 is decreased by pVHL knockdown.

(d) Starvation elevates Dvl2-Cul2 interaction. After co-transfection with Myc-Cul2 and Flag-Dvl2 for 36 h, HEK-293T cells were cultured in nutrient-rich medium or starved with BFA1 (0.1 μM) for 4 h. Cells were harvested for anti-Myc immunoprecipitation followed by anti-Flag immunoblotting. Total protein expression was confirmed by immunoblotting with whole-cell lysates.
(e) pVHL knockdown or UbKOGA blocks Dvl2 binding with p62 under starvation conditions.
(f) Dvl2 ubiquitylation is required for its direct interaction with p62. Dvl2 was ubiquitylated by the pVHL E3 ligase complex in vitro, followed by in vitro binding assay with recombinant p62.
(g) pVHL knockdown decreases Dvl2 degradation under starvation conditions.
(h) Knockdown of p62 or LC3 attenuates the pVHL-promoted Dvl2 degradation under starvation conditions. Uncropped images of blots are shown in Supplementary Information, Fig. S8.

fig.title: a, b) Depletion of Beclin 1 by shRNA promotes growth in soft agar.
fig.label: figf7

sd-panel.p: (a, b) Depletion of Beclin 1 by shRNA promotes growth in soft agar. SW480 cells stably expressing Beclin 1 shRNA or control shRNA were seeded in soft agar and treated with or without Dkk (a); the colonies were then scored after 10 days (b). Numbers in bars indicate the numbers of colonies. Results are means ± s.d. (n = 4). (Asterisk, P 0.05). Scale bar, 200 μm.

(c) Representative images from colon cancer tissues by immunohistochemistry staining. Negative correlation between Beclin1 and Dvl was observed in late stages of tumours, whereas positive correlation between p62 and Dvl in late stages of tumours. Scale bar, 25 μm.
(d) Immunoblotting of human colon tumour samples versus normal tissues using indicated antibodies. N, normal tissue; T, tumour.
(e) Working model of autophagic degradation of Dvl2.
